page.title: 11Churches,Kinbrace
page.content: There are two Churches in Kinbrace. The Free Church is a stone building and was built in the 1890s. The Church of Scotland is made of timber covered with corrugated iron and was built in 1920. Monthly services are held in the Free Church but there are no services in the Church of Scotland due to lack of interest and depopulation. The churchyard near Kinbrace is on a sandy knoll. There is a very interesting gravestone with mortality emblems- a man's face, a coffin and a bell. It is dated 1779. In a lonely spot amid the hills not very far from Kinbrace is a churchyard and the ruins of a very old church which was last used at the beginning of the 19th century. Around are the remains of homesteads which were burnt at the time of the notorious Highland Clearances.
